name: One Step at a Dice
description:
One Step at a Dice is a block sliding puzzle game where your goal is to move the dice to the finish, but there's a catch. Rollling certain numbers will make things happen.

Made in roughly 20 hours by a single person.

Controls

The game teaches you everything you need, but if you need a refreshment, here is everything you need to know.

There are two ways to control the game:

  • By swiping in the direction where you want to move the cube
  • Or by just simply using the WASD or the arrow keys

In the main menu you can either click on the platforms to activate them, or you can navigate with the dice, than press space or enter to enter the level.

  • You can reset the level by pressing R
  • You can quit to the main menu by pressing Escape
Audio

There's no audio... Don't search for it...

I had a very busy weekend, but I still wanted to participate in the jam. But unluckily because of my time limit I wasn't able to add audio to the game.
